Not necessarily. And I am not aware of any evidence that supports a claim that fantasies cause homosexuality. But there is certainly a causal relationship in the other direction: if you’re gay, then you’ll have gay fantasies. If you Google for it, I am certain you will find various studies that show that straight people do fantasize about same-sex sexual contact now and then even if they do not pursue it. Rather, I think you have to look at the prevalence, frequency, and quality of your sexual fantasies over all. If you think about same-sex sex all the time, well, that might be a sign that you’re gay. If you only fantasize about it occasionally, perhaps you’re bisexual. If you are very young, though: I would be cautious about regarding your sexual fantasies as some sort of irrefutable test of your sexual identity. Young people are often very easily aroused by all number of things. As you age, you’ll probably find some greater consistency in what appeals to you.

A2A Homosexuality is romantic attraction,sexual attraction, orsexual behaviorbetween members of the same sex or gender. As a sexual orientation, homosexuality is an enduring patternof emotional,romantic, and/orsexualattractions to people of the same sex.[1] That is what it means to be gay. Homosexual fantasies, in and of themselves, do not necessarily amount to one being gay. However, they may be an indicator of homosexuality. If they persist in duration and intensity, they indicate a sexual attraction to members of the same sex. That satisfies the definition of homosexuality as a sexual orientation. Taking your question literally, nothing “makes” a person gay other than one’s DNA. Same-sex sexual orientation is an innate and immutable heritable trait.[2] It’s hard coded in one’s DNA. That’s what “makes” a person gay. Homosexual fantasies do not cut it except in so far as they accurately indicate same-sex sexual orientation, or in so far as they are harbingers of homosexual behavior yet to come.
